column4: ﻿bobertdos: to the mount point (/media/data in my case), yes, and it is mounted with the "user" option
does running mount from the command line show that /media/data is mounted rw?
cheers, it is mounted as rw, "/dev/sda5 on /media/data type fuseblk (rw,noexec,nosuid,nodev,noatime,allow_other,blksize=512)"
if it were mounted as a specific user, there would be a uid= option. I do not see that. bobertdos is correct in verifying permissions then.
